description:
Tsubasa becomes a superstar amongst soccer players in Brazil. He is now planning to play in Europe. At an important must-win game, as the fans cheer him on, Tsubasa looks back at the days when he started his soccer life. His passion to make goals and win the game is as strong as it was during his childhood. He recalls the games and moments that had decisive impact on his life. He remembers Goalkeeper Wakabayashi, Genius striker Hyuga, tender-hearted Misaki and Coach Roberto. He was happy to meet them, enjoyed playing with them, and learned many things from them. The whistle sounds and the game begins. Tsubasa dashes for the ball!

(Source: AniDB)

node.description:
Youichi Takahashi is a mangaka, best known for [Captain Tsubasa](https://anilist.co/manga/31789/Captain-Tsubasa/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/0728takahashi)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/前田実)

Well-known for his work in the [Dragon Ball](https://anilist.co/anime/223/) series.

_Note: Not to be confused with [background artist](https://anilist.co/staff/219450/)._

__[Website](https://dapump.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/DAPUMPJP)__ | __[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/dapumpjp)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/DAPUMPch)__

__Formed:__ 1996

__Introduction:__
DA PUMP is a Japanese boy band under record label SONIC GROOVE (2011-), having previously been under record label avex tune (1997-2010)

__Members:__
- [Issa Hentona](https://anilist.co/staff/216060) (辺土名一茶) – leader, vocalist, MC (1996-)
- Daichi Kato (加藤大地) – dancer (2008-)
- Tomoki Nakamura (中村朋揮) – dancer (2008-)
- Tomohiro Taniguchi (谷口知広) – MC, dancer(2008-)
- [Kimitaka Kondou](https://anilist.co/staff/163044/Kimitaka-Kondou) (近藤公貴) – MC, dancer (2008-)
- YORI – dancer, chorus (2008-)
- Yuuya Tanimoto (谷本裕也) – dancer, MC, chorus (2008-)

__Former Members:__
- Shinobu Miyara (宮良忍) – MC, dancer, chorus (1996-2005)
- Yukinari Tamaki (玉城幸也) – MC, dancer, chorus (1996-2008)
- Ken Okumoto (奥本健) – choreographer, lead MC, dance, chorus (1996-2009)
- Kazuma Yamane (山根和馬) (2008–2013)

Giorgio Vincenzo Vanni is an Italian singer and song-writer.  Vanni is well known for performing theme songs of Italian dubs of Japanese and American animated TV series.   The dubbed Italian songs he sings usually are not covers of the Japanese songs but tend to be newly written songs for the Italian dub of the anime.   (Source: Wikipedia)

An Italian singer and actress. She sings for television and animation series, and has recorded numerous albums, selling nearly 7 million copies. In Italy, she is also known for singing the Italian version of the theme song of many anime, including One Piece, Doraemon, Attacker YOU! ("Mila e Shiro" in Italian), Sailor Moon and Captain Tsubasa ("Holly e Benji" in Italian).
MAX is a Japanese female vocal group. The name is an acronym for "musical active experience".

Birthplace: München, Germany
Real Name: Jochen Seibert

[Official Website](http://www.noelpix.de/)
